Transforming the Sketch into 3D Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the rotation angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extruding the Sketch Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by a distance of 0.0214 units. The shape of this part is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slit in the middle. The slit is parallel to the longer sides of the prism. The length of this part is 0.75 units, the width is 0.0214 units, and the height is 0.0214 units. Part 2 Creating the Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.2027, 0.0, 0.0] Creating the Sketch Begin by creating a sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. Extruding the Sketch Extrude the sketch along the negative Z-axis by a distance of 0.1712 units. The shape of this part is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 4 units by 6 units. The length of this part is 0.375 units, the width is 0.1712 units, and the height is 0.375 units. This part is then subtracted from the previous part to create the slit in the middle of the prism.</description>
